p: Overall, ALB LI (L) had the highest vectorial capacity (0.53), while AEG MI (H) had the lowest (0.09). Across all populations, increasing temperatures decreased vectorial capacity ( Table 2). When comparing both the Ae. aegypti and Ae. albopictus populations at the same temperature regime (M), vectorial capacity was modestly higher for Ae. aegypti (ALB LI (M) = 0.17, AEG MI (M) = 0.26, AEG MX (M) = 0.33; Table 2). The decreased transmissibility at a higher temperature in Ae. albopictus can be wholly attributed to decreased feeding frequency while decreases in Ae. aegypti are influenced primarily by decreased longevity, but additionally by decreased feeding, decreased competence and increased EIPs ( Table 2).
